intro: Senecio intrepidus, commonly known as the bold senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, displaying vibrant yellow flowers. It is known for its drought tolerance and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Senecio intrepidus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and resilience.
